context: is this keyboard wireless? does anybody know about a woreless gaming keyboard. or any wireless keyboard good for league?
response: No this is not wireless. As a gamer I would not suggest using a wireless keyboard or mouse as they inherently have delays which may effect game play.

context: Do you need a Wii U to play this game or can you play the game on just the Wii?
response: No you need the Wii u.

context: Will this work with Grand Theft Auto V?
response: Not well, you can use it driving but there are buttons missing to walk around so you can't walk without switching controllers :(

context: Does the pc version come on a disk with the DLCs? or are the DLCs on a code? thank you
response: The cd downloads steam, then you put a code in and it gives you the game and dlc

context: Does this headset have an adapter to allow it to connect to a headphone jack on a TV/phone to double as a headset for watching movies, music etc.
response: Yes, you can plug an audio source into the transmitter via the 3.5mm port but you will only get analog stereo, not surround sound. For surround sound you need to use digital optical.

context: will this game work with windows 8.1?
response: It actually works amazing on windows 8.1

context: how can i access the game after buying the code
response: you would go to steam in the bottom left corner click add game then activate a product on steam and enter the code

context: Does this legendary edition have the  game on a disc that I can install or is it only a download client? I do not want to spend a week downloading
response: It has the base game, but it does not have any of the DLC on disk. You need to register the product code with Steam and then you can download the DLC.

context: Does purchasing the game here give a steam key?
response: Indeed it does. All of CKII and its respective DLC are Steam managed DRM.

context: can any character work on  the starter pack?

context: Since my Xbox One (with Kinect) is synced with my TV, can I also listen to TV shows & movies with these wirelessly?  THANKS!
response: We have the 360 but everything we do through the Xbox comes through the headphones (Netflix, YouTube, Xbox Video, etc.) as long as the Xbox is the actual source of the sound output. Hope this helps!!!
